thread.title: LEGO fries, more kawaii coming from soon-to-open LEGOLAND Japan
thread.title_full: LEGO fries, more kawaii coming from soon-to-open LEGOLAND Japan

title: LEGO fries, more kawaii coming from soon-to-open LEGOLAND Japan
text:
LEGO fries, more kawaii coming from soon-to-open LEGOLAND Japan INQUIRER.net / 06:59 PM March 13, 2017 These fries from Oasis Snacks are the kind of LEGO bricks that you don’t leave lying around. Image: LEGOLAND Japan 
With just a month to go before opening, LEGOLAND Japan, in its official website released teaser photos of some of the food items, restaurants and stalls that will be featured in the park. The seven distinct areas of LEGOLAND Japan are Factory, Bricktopia, Adventure, Knight’s Kingdom, Pirate Shore, Miniland and LEGO City. Image: LEGOLAND Japan 
LEGOLAND Japan will be divided into seven areas with eight food stands and five restaurants for guests to indulge in, reports RocketNews24. Cool down with some colorful slushies at Bricktopia. Image: LEGOLAND Japan Pick up some sweets from the PINO Cart. Image: LEGOLAND Japan Grab a chicken dinner at the end of the day. Image LEGOLAND Japan Stuff your belly at the Coral Reef Pizza&Pasta Buffet. Image: LEGOLAND Japan Stop by at the Marina Snack Shack for some hotdogs. Image: LEGOLAND Japan 
LEGOLAND Japan in Nagoya will open its gates on April 1. Kinjo Futo is the nearest train station to the park and is about twenty minutes away from Nagoya station. International visitors may check out their official English website for further details. Alfred Bayle/ JB ADVERTISEMENT
